properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 10:09AM PST until February 5 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...Active Winter Weather Returns to the Area...

.A Pacific storm system will bring snow to all elevations of the
region beginning Tuesday afternoon and continuing into Wednesday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches
in the valleys and 3 to 7 inches in the mountains. Bonners
Ferry and Porthill will see less than 1 inch of snowfall.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport,
Schweitzer Mountain Road, Colville, Northport, Deer Park,
Chewelah, Newport, Kettle Falls, Springdale-Hunters Road, Orin-
Rice Road, and Flowery Trail Road.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to noon PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute and especially the
Wednesday morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin late this afternoon
and increase in intensity overnight and Wednesday morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST WEDNESDAY
